main.docTitle: Electoral Affairs Commission (Electoral Procedure) (Legislative Council) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: authorized representative (獲授權代表) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);
ballot paper account (選票結算表) means a statement prepared under section 64;
ballot paper sorting station (選票分流站) means a place designated as a ballot paper sorting station under section 28; (L.N. 130 of 2009)
by-election notice (補選公告) means a notice published under section 8;

def.name: Candidate
def.leadIn: candidate (候選人) means, subject to subsection (2)— (14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a particular functional constituency—a candidate who is validly nominated to be returned as a Member for that functional constituency at a general election or by-election; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Election Committee constituency—a candidate who is validly nominated to be returned as a Member for the Election Committee constituency at a general election or by-election; (14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.def: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee (候選人資格審查委員會) means the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee established under section 9A of the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569); (14 of 2021 s. 81)

central counting station (中央點票站) means a counting station designated under section 28(9)(a)(ii) in relation to a general election for counting the votes for functional constituencies and the Election Committee constituency; (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 81)
Chief Returning Officer (總選舉主任) means the Returning Officer designated as such under section 99(a);
constituency (選區或界別) means a geographical constituency, a functional constituency or the Election Committee constituency; (14 of 2021 s. 81)
counting agent (監察點票代理人) means a person appointed as a counting agent under section 66;
counting of the votes (點票) includes, where appropriate, the separation, sorting and counting of ballot papers;
counting officer (點票人員) means, in relation to a counting station, a person appointed under section 67 as a counting officer for that counting station;
counting station (點票站) means a place designated as a counting station under section 28;

counting zone (點票區) means an area within a counting station assigned by the Chief Returning Officer, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate, for the counting of the votes; (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 130 of 2009)
dedicated polling station (專用投票站) means a place designated as a dedicated polling station under section 28; (L.N. 130 of 2009)
ECC ballot paper (選委會界別選票) means a ballot paper to vote for a candidate standing for election for the Election Committee constituency; (14 of 2021 s. 81)

ECC polling station (選委會界別投票站) means a polling station assigned by the Chief Electoral Officer under section 30(1)(b) to conduct the polling for the Election Committee constituency; (14 of 2021 s. 81)
election (選舉) means a general election or a by-election;

def.name: ElectionAdvertisement
def.leadIn: election advertisement (選舉廣告), in relation to an election, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a publicly exhibited notice, leaflet, circular, bill, booklet, placard or poster;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice, leaflet, circular, bill, booklet, placard or poster delivered by hand or electronic transmission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public announcement made by radio or television or by video or cinematographic film; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other form of publication,

def.continued: published for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; (11 of 2012 s. 6)

subsection.def: election agent (選舉代理人) means a person appointed as an election agent under section 23;
Election Committee constituency (選舉委員會界別) has the meaning given by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542); (14 of 2021 s. 81)

Election Committee final register (選舉委員會正式委員登記冊) means the final register of members of the Election Committee compiled under the Electoral Affairs Commission (Registration) (Electors for Legislative Council Functional Constituencies) (Voters for Election Committee Subsectors) (Members of Election Committee) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. B) and which is in effect; (14 of 2021 s. 81)
election expense agent (選舉開支代理人) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554); (L.N. 65 of 2000)

election expenses (選舉開支) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554), but the reference to “an election” in that meaning is to be construed as the election referred to in section 4(1)(b) or (c) of that Ordinance; (10 of 2000 s. 47; L.N. 65 of 2000; 11 of 2012 s. 6)

def.name: ElectionNotice
def.leadIn: election notice (選舉公告) means— (14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a geographical constituency—a notice published under section 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a functional constituency—a notice published under section 5; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Election Committee constituency—a notice published under section 6A; (14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.def: emblem (標誌) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M); (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 47 of 2007)

def.name: FCBallotPaper
def.leadIn: FC ballot paper (功能界別選票) means a ballot paper to vote for a candidate standing for election for a functional constituency; (11 of 2012 s. 66; 14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the geographical constituencies final register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the functional constituencies final register; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Election Committee final register; (14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.def: functional constituencies final register (功能界別正式選民登記冊) means the final register of electors for functional constituencies compiled under the Electoral Affairs Commission (Registration) (Electors for Legislative Council Functional Constituencies) (Voters for Election Committee Subsectors) (Members of Election Committee) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. B) and which is in effect; (L.N. 200 of 2001)
functional constituency (功能界別) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);
GC ballot paper (地方選區選票) means a ballot paper to vote for a candidate standing for election for a geographical constituency;

GC counting station (地方選區點票站) means a counting station designated under section 28(9)(a)(i) in relation to a general election for counting the votes for one geographical constituency; (L.N. 65 of 2000)

GC polling station (地方選區投票站) means a polling station assigned by the Chief Electoral Officer under section 30(1)(a) to conduct the polling for a particular geographical constituency; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 81)
general election (換屆選舉) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);

geographical constituencies final register (地方選區正式選民登記冊) means the final register of electors for geographical constituencies compiled under the Electoral Affairs Commission (Registration of Electors) (Legislative Council Geographical Constituencies) (District Council Geographical Constituencies) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. A) and which is in effect; (L.N. 284 of 1999; 19 of 2023 s. 110)

geographical constituency or GC (地方選區) means an area declared to be a geographical constituency under section 18(2)(a) of, or Schedule 6 to, the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542); (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 81)
head-dress (頭飾) means anything which is worn on a person’s head; (L.N. 84 of 2004)
identity card (身分證) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1A of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); (L.N. 147 of 1998)
identity document (身分證明文件) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);

def.name: InCustody
def.leadIn: in custody (受羈押), in relation to a person, means the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serving a sentence of imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand; or

paragraph.name: c

def.name: LawEnforcementAgency
def.leadIn: law enforcement agency (執法機關) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Customs and Excise Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Police Force;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Immigration Department;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Independent Commission Against Corruption; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other department of the Government any officer of which is empowered by any Ordinance to exercise a power of arrest; (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.def: main counting station (大點票站) means a place designated as a main counting station under section 28; (L.N. 84 of 2004)
maximum security prison (高度設防監獄) means a prison which is specified as a maximum security prison under rule 47A(1)(b) of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A); (L.N. 130 of 2009)
no canvassing zone (禁止拉票區) means an area determined under section 40 to be an area in which canvassing of votes is prohibited;
no staying zone (禁止逗留區) means an area determined under section 40 to be an area in which staying or loitering is prohibited;
nomination form (提名表格) means a form referred to in section 10(1), 11(1) or 12A(1) (as applicable); (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 81)

def.name: NominationPeriod
def.leadIn: nomination period (提名期) means— (14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to nominations for a geographical constituency—the period specified under section 4(2)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to nominations for a functional constituency—the period specified under section 5(2)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to nominations for the Election Committee constituency—the period specified under section 6A(2)(b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a by-election for a constituency—the relevant period specified under section 8(7)(a); (14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.def: Nominations Advisory Committee (提名顧問委員會) means a committee appointed under the Electoral Affairs Commission (Nominations Advisory Committees (Legislative Council)) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. C); (L.N. 115 of 1999)

def.name: NoticeAppointingTheElectionDay
def.leadIn: notice appointing the election day (指定選舉日公告) means, in relation to a general election, a notice by which a date is specified by the Chief Executive under the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) to hold an election to return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Members to be returned for geographical constituencies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Members to be returned for functional constituencies; or

paragraph.name: c

subsection.def: notice of nominations (提名公告) means a notice published under section 21; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 11 of 2012 s. 43; 14 of 2021 s. 81)

def.name: OrdinaryBusinessHours
def.leadIn: ordinary business hours (通常辦公時間) means the hours—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. on any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday (other than a general holiday); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: between 9 a.m. and 12 noon on a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 4(1), 5(1), 6A(1) or 8(1) in respect of an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the result of the election under the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) or the date of the declaration of the failure of the election under that Ordinance, whichever is the later; (12 of 2014 s. 93; 14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.def: polling agent (監察投票代理人) means a person appointed as a polling agent under section 42;
polling day (投票日) means the date on which the poll is to be held in an election;
polling hours (投票時間) means the hours for polling appointed under section 27;
polling officer (投票站人員) means, in relation to a polling station, a person appointed under section 34(2) as a polling officer for that polling station;
polling station (投票站) means a place designated as a polling station under section 28;

prescribed body (訂明團體) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M); (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 47 of 2007)

prescribed person (訂明人士) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M); (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 47 of 2007)

def.name: PresidingOfficer
def.leadIn: Presiding Officer (投票站主任) means— (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a ballot paper sorting station, the person appointed under section 66A(1) as the Presiding Officer for that ballot paper sorting station; (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.def: registered (登記), in the context of a registered emblem or a registered name, has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M); (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 47 of 2007)
registered residential address (登記住址) means, in relation to a person, the address recorded in the particulars of that person in the geographical constituencies final register;
Returning Officer (選舉主任) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);
small polling station (小投票站) means a place designated as a small polling station under section 28; (L.N. 84 of 2004)
special polling station (特別投票站) means a polling station designated as such under section 29;

specified address (指明地點) means, in relation to a geographical constituency, a functional constituency or the Election Committee constituency, the address specified in the relevant election notice or by-election notice as the address at which the nomination forms are to be submitted; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 81)
spoilt ballot paper (損壞的選票) means a spoilt ballot paper within the meaning of section 62;
tendered ballot paper (重複的選票) means a tendered ballot paper within the meaning of section 60;
unused ballot paper (未用的選票) means an unused ballot paper within the meaning of section 61(2);

def.name: ValidlyNominatedCandidate
def.leadIn: validly nominated candidate (獲有效提名的候選人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), a person whom the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee has decided under section 16 to be validly nominated; (14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in case a declaration under section 42B(2)(b) or (5)(b) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) is made, a person who is stated to be validly nominated in the declaration; (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.def: verification of number of ballot papers (選票數目核實書) means a statement prepared under section 73B(1)(d), 73C(1)(d), 73D(1)(b) or (2)(a)(iii), 73E(1)(d) or 77AA(8). (14 of 2021 s. 81; 8 of 2025 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: in Part 2, candidate (候選人) includes a person who is being or has been nominated as a candidate to stand for election as a Member; and

def.name: Candidate
def.leadIn: in section 25 and Part 7, candidate (候選人)— (11 of 2012 s. 6)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: means a person who stands nominated as a candidate at an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: also means a person who, at any time before close of nominations for an election, has publicly declared an intention to stand as a candidate at the election. (L.N. 65 of 2000; 14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless it is provided otherwise, a reference to “Returning Officer” is to be construed— (14 of 2021 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a geographical constituency—as the Returning Officer appointed for that geographical constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a functional constituency—as the Returning Officer appointed for that functional constituency; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Election Committee constituency—as the Returning Officer appointed for the Election Committee constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 81)

subsection.content: In this Regulation, any provision which entitles or permits a candidate, an election agent, a polling agent or a counting agent to do anything in a polling station, counting station, counting zone or in relation to the counting of the votes is to be construed as entitling or permitting the candidate or the agent to do it in a polling station, counting station, counting zone or in relation to the counting of the votes for the constituency for which the candidate is standing for election or for which the agent is appointed, as the case may require.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless it is provided otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to “counting station” is to be construed as including a main counting station and a ballot paper sorting station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to “polling station” is to be construed as including a small polling station, a special polling station and a dedicated polling station. (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 130 of 2009)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during ordinary business hours;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 4(1), 5(1), 6A(1) or 8(1) in respect of an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the result of the election under the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) or the date of the declaration of the failure of the election under that Ordinance, whichever is the later. (14 of 2021 s. 82)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date is prescribed in this Regulation (whether by reference to a specific day of a specific month or to a day otherwise ascertainable under this Regulation) or is fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done not later than, or on or before, the date or on the date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date is taken to be prescribed or fixed in relation to the act instead for the provision.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period is prescribed in or fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done in, during or within the period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the last day of the period falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended, in relation to the act, to end on the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (c), and the provision has effect accordingly.

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) are subject to Schedule 2.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: Except where otherwise stated, this Regulation applies to a general election and a by-election.
In their application to a by-election, Parts 3 and 4 are to be read subject to necessary modifications.
Schedule 2 applies to a general election and by-election. (L.N. 210 of 2001)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Nomination of Candidates and Other Stages of an Election before the Poll: General Election and By-elections

section.name: s4
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to publish a notice specifying a period and place for submitting nomination forms for geographical constituencies

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the publication of the notice appointing the election day, the Chief Electoral Officer must publish in the Gazette, for the geographical constituencies, a notice which complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice referred to in subsection (1) must state in relation to each geographical constituency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the geographical constituency and the number of Members to be returned for that geographical constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which nomination forms for the geographical constituency are to be submitted to the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address at which the nomination forms are to be submitted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be submitted during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date on which the election for the geographical constituency is to be held; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that a poll will be held on the date referred to in paragraph (e) for the geographical constituency, if the number of validly nominated candidates for that geographical constituency exceeds the number of Members to be returned for that geographical constituency.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to publish a notice specifying a period and place for submitting nomination forms for functional constituencies

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the publication of the notice appointing the election day, the Chief Electoral Officer must publish in the Gazette, for the functional constituencies, a notice which complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice referred to in subsection (1) must state in relation to each functional constituency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the functional constituency and the number of Members to be returned for that functional constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which nomination forms for the functional constituency are to be submitted to the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address at which the nomination forms are to be submitted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be submitted during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date on which the election for the functional constituency is to be held; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that a poll will be held on the date referred to in paragraph (e) for the functional constituency, if the number of validly nominated candidates for that functional constituency exceeds the number of Members to be returned for that functional constituency.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to publish notice specifying period and place for submitting nomination forms for Election Committee constituency

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the publication of the notice appointing the election day, the Chief Electoral Officer must publish in the Gazette, for the Election Committee constituency, a notice that complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice mentioned in subsection (1) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of Members to be returned for the Election Committee constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which nomination forms for the Election Committee constituency are to be submitted to the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address at which the nomination forms are to be submitted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be submitted during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date on which the election for the Election Committee constituency is to be held; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that a poll will be held on the date referred to in paragraph (e) for the Election Committee constituency, if the number of validly nominated candidates standing for that constituency exceeds the number of Members to be returned for that constituency.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to determine nomination period

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the nomination period is to be determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

The nomination period must not begin earlier than the date on which the election notice or the by-election notice, as the case may be, is published in the Gazette. The nomination period must not be less than 14 days or more than 21 days. (L.N. 65 of 2000)
The nomination period must end not less than 28 days and not more than 42 days before the date on which the relevant election is to be held.

Despite subsections (2) and (3), the nomination period may be longer than 21 days and may end during the period of 28 days before the date on which the relevant election is to be held if the nomination period is extended under section 2A(3). (12 of 2014 s. 6)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to publish by-election notice if a by-election is to be held under section 36 of the Legislative Council Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to section 36(2) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), as soon as practicable after a declaration referred to in section 36(1)(a), (c) or (cb), or a determination referred to in section 36(1)(d), of that Ordinance is made, in order to hold a by-election for the purposes of that section 36(1), the Chief Electoral Officer must publish in the Gazette, a notice in accordance with this section. (L.N. 65 of 2000; 14 of 2021 s. 84)

If a by-election is to be held for a geographical constituency or geographical constituencies, the by-election notice must state the name of the geographical constituency or each geographical constituency for which the by-election is to be held, and the number of Members to be returned for the geographical constituency or each geographical constituency at the by-election.

If a by-election is to be held for a functional constituency or functional constituencies, the by-election notice must state the name of the functional constituency or each functional constituency for which the by-election is to be held, and the number of Members to be returned for the functional constituency or each functional constituency at the by-election.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: If a by-election is to be held for the Election Committee constituency, the by-election notice must state the number of Members to be returned for that constituency at the by-election. (14 of 2021 s. 84)
In each case referred to in subsections (2), (3) and (4A), the by-election notice must state the date on which the by-election is to be held. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 84)

The by-election notice must also state that a poll will be held on the relevant date referred to in subsection (5), if the number of candidates validly nominated for the geographical constituency, functional constituency or Election Committee constituency exceeds the number of Members to be returned for that constituency at the by-election. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 84)

subsection.leadIn: The by-election notice must also state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period within which nomination forms for the by-election are to be submitted to the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address at which nomination forms are to be submitted; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be submitted during ordinary business hours.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Election notice to be in the specified form
section.content: An election notice or a by-election notice must be in the specified form.

section.name: s10
section.heading: How to nominate a candidate for a geographical constituency

subsection.content: A person is to be nominated as a candidate for a geographical constituency by submitting to the Returning Officer a nomination form that complies with this section. (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 85)
The nomination form must be submitted in accordance with this section. (11 of 2019 s. 18; 14 of 2021 s. 85)
The nomination form must be in the specified form and subscribed in accordance with the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C).

The candidate must make the declarations and promissory oath required by section 40(1)(b) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) in the appropriate place on the nomination form. (14 of 2021 s. 85)

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must contain a declaration by the candidate to the effect that the candidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for a geographical constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being so nominated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consents to being so nominated. (14 of 2021 s. 85)

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must contain—

subparagraph.content: the name of the candidate as shown on the candidate’s identity document (being the identity document on the basis of which the particulars of the candidate are recorded in the geographical constituencies final register); and
the identity document number and address of the candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is usually known by a name different from that shown on the identity document mentioned in paragraph (a)(i)—may also include that different name. (14 of 2021 s. 85)

subsection.content: The nomination form must be signed by the candidate in each place the candidate’s signature is required on that form. (14 of 2021 s. 85)
The nomination form must be signed by each subscriber. It must contain the name and identity document number of each subscriber. (L.N. 84 of 2004)
The nomination form must contain other particulars (if any) required to be furnished on that form.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may require a candidate to furnish any other information that Officer considers appropriate for enabling the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to be satisfied— (14 of 2021 s. 85)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for a geographical constituency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise as to the validity of the nomination. (14 of 2021 s. 85)

subsection.name: 10A
subsection.content: Only 1 person can be nominated by each nomination form. (14 of 2021 s. 85)
The nomination form must be submitted to the Returning Officer within the nomination period at the specified address.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must be submitted by the candidate— (14 of 2021 s. 85)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a way authorized by the Chief Electoral Officer. (11 of 2019 s. 18)

section.name: s11
section.heading: How to nominate a candidate for a functional constituency

subsection.content: A person is to be nominated as a candidate for a functional constituency by submitting to the Returning Officer a nomination form that complies with this section. (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 86)
The nomination form must be submitted in accordance with this section.
The nomination form must be in the specified form and subscribed in accordance with the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C).
The candidate must make the declarations and promissory oath required by section 40(1)(b) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) in the appropriate place on the nomination form.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must contain a declaration by the candidate to the effect that he or she—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for the functional constituency concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being so nominated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consents to being so nominated.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must contain—

subparagraph.content: the name of the candidate as shown on the candidate’s identity document (being the identity document on the basis of which the particulars of the candidate are recorded in the geographical constituencies final register); and
the identity document number and address of the candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is usually known by a name different from that shown on the identity document mentioned in paragraph (a)(i)—may also include that different name. (14 of 2021 s. 86)

subsection.content: The nomination form must be signed by the candidate in each place the candidate’s signature is required on that form.
The nomination form must be signed by each subscriber. It must contain the name and identity document number of each subscriber. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

In the case of an elector other than a natural person, the subscription of the nomination form by that elector may only be effected by that elector’s authorized representative. (L.N. 147 of 1998; 14 of 2021 s. 86)
The nomination form must contain other particulars (if any) required to be furnished on that form. (L.N. 147 of 1998)

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may require a candidate to furnish any other information that Officer considers appropriate for enabling the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to be satisfied— (L.N. 147 of 1998; 14 of 2021 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for the functional constituency concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise as to the validity of the nomination. (14 of 2021 s. 86)

subsection.content: Only 1 person can be nominated by each nomination form. (14 of 2021 s. 86)
The nomination form must be submitted to the Returning Officer within the nomination period at the specified address. (L.N. 147 of 1998)

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must be submitted by the candidate— (L.N. 147 of 1998; 14 of 2021 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a way authorized by the Chief Electoral Officer. (14 of 2021 s. 86)

section.name: s12A
section.heading: How to nominate candidate for Election Committee constituency

subsection.content: A person is to be nominated as a candidate for the Election Committee constituency by submitting to the Returning Officer a nomination form that complies with this section.
The nomination form must be submitted in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subscribed in accordance with the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C).

subsection.content: The candidate must make the declarations and promissory oath required by section 40(1)(b) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) in the appropriate place on the nomination form.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must contain a declaration by the candidate to the effect that the candidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for the Election Committee constituency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not disqualified from being so nominated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consents to being so nominated.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must contain—

subparagraph.content: the name of the candidate as shown on the candidate’s identity document (being the identity document on the basis of which the particulars of the candidate are recorded in the geographical constituencies final register); and
the identity document number and address of the candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is usually known by a name different from that shown on the identity document mentioned in paragraph (a)(i)—may also include that different name.

subsection.content: The nomination form must be signed by the candidate in each place the candidate’s signature is required on that form.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be signed by each subscriber; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the name and identity document number of each subscriber.

subsection.content: The nomination form must contain other particulars (if any) required to be furnished on that form.

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may require a candidate to furnish any other information that Officer considers appropriate for enabling the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to be satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for the Election Committee constituency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise as to the validity of the nomination.

subsection.content: Only 1 person can be nominated by each nomination form.
The nomination form must be submitted to the Returning Officer within the nomination period at the specified address.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination form must be submitted by the candidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a way authorized by the Chief Electoral Officer.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Returning Officer may assist in preparation of nomination forms
section.content: The Returning Officer may, at the request of a person who proposes to be nominated as a candidate, give assistance in preparing a nomination form.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Returning Officer to make available copies of nomination forms for public inspection
section.content: The Returning Officer must make available for inspection by the public, at the specified address, during ordinary business hours, a copy of each of the nomination forms received by that Officer. A nomination form must be made so available as soon as practicable after it is received by the Returning Officer and until the relevant notice of election result is published under section 58 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Returning Officer not to accept nomination form without deposit and to issue receipt for deposit

subsection.content: The Returning Officer may accept a nomination form only if it is accompanied by the appropriate deposit.
When the Returning Officer receives the appropriate deposit, that Officer must issue a receipt for the amount of the deposit.

subsection.def: In this section and section 16, appropriate deposit (適當的按金) means the amount of deposit to be lodged under the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C), having regard to which constituency for which the nomination form is submitted. (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 73 of 2011; E.R. 6 of 2019)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to decide whether candidates are validly nominated

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must, as soon as practicable after receiving a nomination form, forward the form to the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee. (14 of 2021 s. 89)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, as soon as practicable after receiving a nomination form forwarded by the Returning Officer, decide whether a candidate is validly nominated. (14 of 2021 s. 89)

subsection.leadIn: If section 10, 11 or 12A (as may be applicable), and sections 37, 39 and 40 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), are complied with in relation to a candidate, the candidate stands validly nominated unless— (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 89)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee decides that the nomination form is invalid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate withdraws his or her candidature.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to sections 37, 39 and 40 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee may decide that a nomination is invalid if and only if— (14 of 2021 s. 89)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nomination form has not been completed or signed as required under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is satisfied that the candidate is not eligible to be or is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate under the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the nomination form relates to a constituency but—

subparagraph.content: the candidate has been nominated for another constituency in the same election; and
the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is satisfied that the other candidature has not been withdrawn; (14 of 2021 s. 89)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the candidate has not lodged the appropriate deposit; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is dead.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether a candidate is validly nominated for a constituency, the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the Returning Officer to advise the Committee, and have regard to such advice of the Returning Officer, as to any of the matters specified in subsection (3B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may require the candidate to furnish any other information that Committee considers appropriate to be satisfied—

subparagraph.content: that the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate for the constituency concerned; or
otherwise as to the validity of the nomination. (14 of 2021 s. 89)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for subsection (3A)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3C), whether, in the opinion of the Returning Officer, sections 37, 39 and 40 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) are complied with in relation to the candidate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the Returning Officer, the nomination form of the candidate is valid;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the candidate has withdrawn candidature for that constituency;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether the nomination form of the candidate has been signed by the prescribed number of subscribers qualified to subscribe to the nomination form under the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether the nomination form of the candidate has been completed or signed as required under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Returning Officer—

subparagraph.content: whether the candidate is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate under that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: h

paragraph.content: whether the candidate has lodged the appropriate deposit; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: whether, according to the information available to the Returning Officer, the candidate is dead. (14 of 2021 s. 89)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3B)(b), the Returning Officer is not to advise on whether a candidate has complied with section 40(1)(b)(i) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542). (14 of 2021 s. 89)

subsection.def: In this section, prescribed number (訂明數目) means the number of subscribers (including how such subscribers are to be composed of) required to subscribe to the nomination form under the Legislative Council (Subscribers and Election Deposit for Nomination) Regulation (Cap. 542 sub. leg. C), having regard to which constituency for which the nomination form is submitted. (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 73 of 2011; E.R. 6 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to section 37, 39 or 40 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) being complied with in relation to a candidate for constituency is to be construed as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for section 39 of that Ordinance—that the candidate is not disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at an election for that constituency under that section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for section 40 of that Ordinance—that the candidate has complied with that section. (14 of 2021 s. 89)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Returning Officer to have regard to advice of Nominations Advisory Committee
section.leadIn: In forming an opinion for the purposes of section 16(3A)(a) and (3B)(g) as to whether a person is eligible to be or is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate, the Returning Officer must have regard to— (14 of 2021 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: advice given by a Nominations Advisory Committee on an application, if any, made by the Returning Officer regarding that person under the Electoral Affairs Commission (Nominations Advisory Committees (Legislative Council)) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. C); or (L.N. 115 of 1999)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advice given by a Nominations Advisory Committee on an application, if any, made by that person to the Nominations Advisory Committee under that Regulation or, if advice has not been given, the result of the application.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Returning Officer may give opportunity to rectify a nomination form

subsection.leadIn: If the Returning Officer detects on a nomination form—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: anything which may affect the validity of the nomination form,

subsection.continued: and the Returning Officer considers that it can be rectified within the nomination period, that Officer may, before forming an opinion for the purposes of section 16(3A)(a) and (3B)(c) as to whether the nomination form is valid, give the candidate a reasonable opportunity to rectify it. (14 of 2021 s. 91)

subsection.content: A nomination form cannot be rectified under this section after the expiry of the nomination period.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to endorse invalid nomination forms and Returning Officer to notify candidates of decision as to validity of nomination

subsection.content: If the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee decides that the nomination of a candidate is invalid, the Committee must endorse on the nomination form the decision and the reasons for it. (14 of 2021 s. 92)
The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must sign an endorsement under subsection (1). (14 of 2021 s. 92)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, after deciding whether a person is validly nominated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Returning Officer of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return the nomination form to the Returning Officer for retention. (14 of 2021 s. 92)

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must send a notice of a decision of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee that a person is validly nominated or is not validly nominated to the person concerned and each validly nominated candidate for the constituency concerned. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 92)
A notice under subsection (3) must be sent to the address of the candidate as given on the nomination form. (L.N. 143 of 2019)

section.name: s20
section.heading: How a nominated candidate is to withdraw from candidature

subsection.content: A withdrawal of candidature for the purposes of section 42 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) is to be effected by giving a notice of withdrawal to the Returning Officer in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The following applies to a notice of withdrawal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the signature of the candidate on the notice must be attested by a witness;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the notice must be delivered to the Returning Officer by the candidate in person or the candidate’s election agent in person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the notice must be so delivered at the specified address.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to publish a notice of particulars of validly nominated candidates

subsection.content: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, within 14 days of the expiry of the nomination period, publish a notice in the Gazette which complies with this section. (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must be published for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all geographical constituencies and functional constituencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Election Committee constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: separate notices may be published for each geographical constituency and each functional constituency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 notice may be published for all the geographical constituencies and 1 notice may be published for all the functional constituencies. (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), a separate notice must be published for the Election Committee constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.leadIn: A notice published for a geographical constituency must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of each validly nominated candidate for that geographical constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number allocated to each candidate under section 49(6A). (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.leadIn: A notice published for a functional constituency must state— (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 93)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of each validly nominated candidate for that functional constituency; and (L.N. 143 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the code assigned to that functional constituency under section 49(8) followed by the number allocated to each candidate under section 49(8A). (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: A notice published for the Election Committee constituency must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of each validly nominated candidate for the Election Committee constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number allocated to each candidate under section 49(10B). (14 of 2021 s. 93)

subsection.content: A notice under this section must be in the specified form.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Returning Officer to publish a notice for the purposes of section 46(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance

subsection.content: If, for a geographical constituency, no more candidates have been validly nominated than the number of Members to be returned for that constituency, the Returning Officer must, for the purposes of section 46(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), declare in a notice the candidate or candidates as being duly elected as a Member or Members for that constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 94)

If, for a functional constituency, no more candidates have been validly nominated than the number of Members to be returned for that constituency, the Returning Officer must, for the purposes of section 46(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), declare in a notice the candidate or candidates as being duly elected as a Member or Members for that constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 94)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: If, for the Election Committee constituency, no more candidates have been validly nominated than the number of Members to be returned for that constituency, the Returning Officer must, for the purposes of section 46(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), declare in a notice the candidate or candidates as being duly elected as a Member or Members for that constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 94)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1), (2) or (3A) must— (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 94)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette within 14 days of the expiry of the nomination period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the name and address of the candidate declared to be duly elected as a Member; and (L.N. 143 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be in the specified form.

section.name: s22A
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify and declare if a validly nominated candidate is proved to have died

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 42B(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) is to be given in writing, by the Returning Officer concerned, as soon as practicable after the death of the candidate is proved to the satisfaction of that Officer, to— (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if practicable, each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned to replace the notice under section 19(3).

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorse on the nomination form of the deceased candidate that the candidate has died; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sign the endorsement. (14 of 2021 s. 95)

subsection.leadIn: Declarations under section 42B(2) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) are to be made, by the Returning Officer concerned, as soon as practicable after the death of the candidate is proved to the satisfaction of that Officer— (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a public announcement made by radio or television; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by such other means as that Officer considers appropriate in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) or (b) must state— (14 of 2021 s. 95)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the name of the constituency for which the deceased candidate was nominated; and (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned. (L.N. 143 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: A public announcement under subsection (3)(c) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the deceased candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the constituency for which the deceased candidate was nominated; and (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned.

section.name: s22B
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify, and Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to declare, if a validly nominated candidate is proved to be disqualified

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 42B(4) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) is to be given in writing, by the Returning Officer concerned, as soon as practicable after the disqualification to which the variation of decision relates is proved to the satisfaction of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee, to— (L.N. 29 of 2004; L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 96)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if practicable, each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned, to replace the notice under section 19(3).

subsection.leadIn: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorse on the nomination form of the disqualified candidate that the Committee’s decision made under section 42A(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) in relation to that candidate is varied and the reason for the variation of decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sign the endorsement. (14 of 2021 s. 96)

subsection.leadIn: Declarations under section 42B(5) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) are to be made by the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee, as soon as practicable after the disqualification to which the variation of decision relates is proved to the satisfaction of the Committee— (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 66 of 2008; 14 of 2021 s. 96)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice published in any daily newspaper in circulation in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a public announcement made by radio or television; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by such other means as the Committee considers appropriate in the circumstances. (14 of 2021 s. 96)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) or (b) must state— (14 of 2021 s. 96)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the disqualified candidate; (L.N. 143 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the constituency for which the disqualified candidate was nominated; (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the decision of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee made under section 42A(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) has been varied to the effect that the candidate is not validly nominated; and (14 of 2021 s. 96)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and address of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned. (L.N. 143 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: A public announcement under subsection (3)(c) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the disqualified candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the constituency for which the disqualified candidate was nominated; and (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of each candidate who remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned.

section.name: s22C
section.heading: No poll upon death or disqualification of candidate under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If, after the death referred to in section 22A(1) or the disqualification referred to in section 22B(1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no candidate remains validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of candidates remaining validly nominated for election for the constituency concerned is less than the number of Members to be returned for that constituency, (11 of 2012 s. 44)

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer must, by such means as that Officer considers appropriate in the circumstances, declare that no poll is to be held for the constituency. (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 73 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer must in the notice under section 22A(3)(a), if any, or in a separate notice— (14 of 2021 s. 97)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), declare, for the purposes of section 46(2) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), the election to have failed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(c), declare—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of section 46(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542), the remaining candidate or candidates as being duly elected as a Member or as Members; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of section 46(2) of that Ordinance, the election to have failed to the extent that the number of candidates remaining validly nominated for election is less than the number of Members to be returned.

subsection.leadIn: A separate notice containing a declaration under subsection (2)(a) or (c)(i) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the name and address of each candidate declared to be duly elected as a Member; and (L.N. 143 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be in the specified form.

subsection.content: A separate notice containing a declaration under subsection (2)(b) or (c)(ii) must comply with section 97B(1).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Election Agents and Election Expense Agents

section.name: s23
section.heading: A candidate may appoint election agent

subsection.content: Each candidate for a constituency may appoint 1 person as the candidate’s election agent. (14 of 2021 s. 98)
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as an election agent. (L.N. 147 of 1998)
A candidate must give notice of appointment of the candidate’s election agent to the Returning Officer. (14 of 2021 s. 98)
The appointment of an election agent is not effective until notice of the appointment is received by the Returning Officer.
A notice of appointment must be in writing and state the name, identity card number and residential address of the election agent. (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 66 of 2008; 12 of 2014 s. 54)
The notice must be signed by the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 98)
A candidate cannot have more than one election agent at any one time. (14 of 2021 s. 98)

If the appointment of an election agent is revoked, notice of revocation must be given to the Returning Officer by the candidate as soon as possible after the revocation. (L.N. 147 of 1998; 14 of 2021 s. 98)
A notice of revocation must be in writing and be signed by the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 98)
The revocation of the appointment of an election agent is not effective until notice of the revocation is received by the Returning Officer.
If at any time an election agent dies or the appointment of an election agent is revoked, the candidate may appoint a replacement. (14 of 2021 s. 98)
The appointment of a replacement must be in accordance with the requirements of this section.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment or a notice of revocation under this section must be— (12 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of an appointment or a revocation of appointment made on polling day) by post. (12 of 2014 s. 54)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (18), an election agent may do all things which a candidate may do under this Regulation in connection with an election. Any such act of the election agent is effective as if it had been done by the candidate in person. (12 of 2014 s. 76; 14 of 2021 s. 98)

subsection.leadIn: An election agent may not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: do anything a candidate is required to do under section 10, 11 or 12A; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 98)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw a candidate’s candidature; (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize any person for the purposes of section 25; (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (e), be present in a dedicated polling station situated in a prison unless, on an application in the specified form delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission to the Chief Electoral Officer at least one week before polling day, the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to his or her presence; or (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: be present in a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must not give consent to an election agent under subsection (18)(d) in respect of a polling station if a polling agent has been appointed under section 42 by the same candidate for that polling station. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 98)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (18)(d), the Commissioner of Correctional Services may, on an application made under that subsection during the week before polling day, give consent under that subsection if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (12 of 2014 s. 54)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody or authorized representative in custody who is entitled to vote for the relevant constituency at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is made without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 54)

subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (18)(d), the Commissioner must notify the candidate or the election agent as soon as practicable. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 98)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Returning Officer to send to other candidates a notice of particulars of election agent

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must send to every candidate for a constituency a notice containing the particulars of the election agents of the other candidates for that constituency. (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 99)

If a replacement is appointed for an election agent, the Returning Officer must send a notice of the particulars of the replacement to the candidates that Officer is required to send a notice under subsection (2). (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 99)
The Returning Officer must send a notice under subsection (2) within 10 days of the expiry of the relevant nomination period. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 99)

If the appointment of the election agent is made after the notice period referred to in subsection (5), or if a replacement is appointed under section 23(14), the Returning Officer must send a notice of the particulars as soon as practicable after that Officer receives notice of the appointment or replacement, as the case may be. (L.N. 147 of 1998; 12 of 2014 s. 7)
The Returning Officer must also display in a prominent place outside that Officer’s office, a notice of the particulars of the election agents.
A notice under this section must be in the specified form.
A notice required to be sent to a candidate under subsection (2) may be sent to the election agent instead of to the candidate. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 99)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Authorization of election expense agent to incur election expenses at or in connection with an election

subsection.content: Only a person who has attained the age of 18 years may be authorized as an election expense agent to incur election expenses at or in connection with an election. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

An authorization of such an election expense agent must be in writing and in the specified form and state the name, identity document number and residential address of the person authorized. (L.N. 65 of 2000)
The authorization must specify the maximum amount of election expenses that the election expense agent is authorized to incur. (L.N. 65 of 2000)
The authorization must be signed by the candidate making the authorization. The authorization must also be signed by the person authorized. (L.N. 65 of 2000; 14 of 2021 s. 100)

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the authorization must be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Returning Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer has not been appointed, on the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.content: A copy of the authorization may be served by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 55)

The Returning Officer or the Chief Electoral Officer, as the case may be, is to regard an authorization of an election expense agent to incur election expenses at or in connection with an election as being effective, for any purpose related to the election for which the authorization is relevant, only when a copy of the authorization has been served on the relevant Officer. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: If the authorization of an election expense agent to incur election expenses at or in connection with an election has been revoked, a written notice of the revocation must be served as soon as possible— (L.N. 66 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Returning Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Returning Officer has not been appointed, on the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 66 of 2008)

subsection.content: The notice of revocation must be in the specified form and signed by the candidate who made the authorization. (L.N. 65 of 2000; 14 of 2021 s. 100)

subsection.name: 15A
subsection.content: The notice of revocation may be served by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 55)

If the authorization of an election expense agent to incur election expenses at or in connection with an election has been revoked, the Returning Officer or the Chief Electoral Officer, as the case may be, is to regard the revocation as being effective, for any purpose related to the election for which the revocation is relevant, only when the relevant Officer receives the notice of revocation. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 65 of 2000)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Copies of authorization of election expense agents to be made available for public inspection
section.content: The Returning Officer or the Chief Electoral Officer, as the case may be, must make available for public inspection a copy of each of the copies of authorizations served on that Officer under section 25. A copy must be made available for public inspection as soon as practicable after that Officer is served the copy of the authorization and until the end of the period for which the copy of the election return lodged by the candidate is available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

part.name: P3
part.heading: Contested Elections: General Election and By-elections

division.name: D1
division.heading: Hours of Poll and Matters Relating to Polling Stations

section.name: s27
section.heading: Appointment and notification of polling hours

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2A) and (2B), the hours during which electors can cast their votes on polling day are to be appointed by the Chief Electoral Officer in accordance with this section. (L.N. 130 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint different polling hours for different constituencies or for different polling stations. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services may assign a time slot during the polling hours appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to an elector in custody to whom the polling station is allocated under section 30. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Subject to section 53A, an elector to whom a time slot is assigned under subsection (2A) may only cast his or her vote during the time slot. (L.N. 130 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer must appoint the polling hours so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must assign the time slot so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must, at least 10 days before polling day, publish in the Gazette, a notice specifying— (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the polling hours for the geographical constituencies, functional constituencies and Election Committee constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if appropriate, the polling hours for each polling station. (14 of 2021 s. 101)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as early as practicable before the commencement of the poll, notify all electors to whom time slots are assigned under subsection (2A) of the time slot assigned to each of them. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.def: In this section, electors (選民) includes authorized representatives. (E.R. 6 of 2019)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Designation of polling stations, counting stations and ballot paper sorting stations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must designate, by notice published in the Gazette at least 10 days before polling day— (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 97)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one or more places as a polling station or polling stations for conducting a poll in respect of an election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more places as a counting station or counting stations for counting of the votes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one or more places as a ballot paper sorting station or ballot paper sorting stations for sorting GC ballot papers received from dedicated polling stations or cast at ECC polling stations in a general election or, where the Chief Electoral Officer considers appropriate, a by-election. (L.N. 130 of 2009; L.N. 197 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 102)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate under subsection (1) the same place as a polling station and a counting station. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must designate a polling station at which less than 500 electors are allocated to vote as a small polling station. (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1ba
subsection.content: Without affecting subsection (1B), the Chief Electoral Officer must designate one or more places as a dedicated polling station or dedicated polling stations at which electors in custody or authorized representatives in custody are allocated to vote. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If in relation to a geographical constituency, 2 or more polling stations have been designated and one or more than one of them is a small polling station, dedicated polling station or ECC polling station, the Chief Electoral Officer must designate a polling station (other than a small polling station, dedicated polling station or ECC polling station) as a main counting station for the purpose of counting the votes cast at the polling station and the small polling stations, dedicated polling stations or ECC polling stations, as may be appropriate. (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004; L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 102)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: premises occupied by a Government department for official purposes (Government building);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a structure, place or premises hired under subsection (3) or which is to be so hired;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any school in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a building occupied by an organization, association or body in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other structure, premises, whether permanent or temporary, mobile or otherwise, or place, which the Chief Electoral Officer considers suitable for a purpose specified in subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may hire any structure, place or premises or a part of a structure, place or premises to designate as a polling station or a counting station.

The Chief Electoral Officer may designate a place described in subsection (2) in addition to or in substitution of a place designated under this section as a polling station or a counting station. The Chief Electoral Officer must publish notice of such designation. The notice may be published in a manner that Officer thinks fit.
The Chief Electoral Officer must ensure that there are sufficient polling stations and counting stations to enable polling and counting of the votes to take place smoothly and efficiently.
The Chief Electoral Officer must make available, at that Officer’s office, for public inspection, a list of the polling stations and counting stations.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must, in the case of a polling station or a counting station which is not a Government building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make good any damage caused; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defray any expenses incurred by any person having control over the structure, place or premises,

subsection.continued: due to their having been used as a polling station or a counting station.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may take such steps as that Officer considers appropriate, including taking out insurance, to insure against any risk of loss or damage that may arise due to or in connection with the use of any structure, place or premises as a polling station or a counting station.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a general election, designate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one or more counting stations for counting the votes for each geographical constituency cast at all the polling stations used for polling for the general election; and

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: counting the votes for the Election Committee constituency cast at all ECC polling stations; and (14 of 2021 s. 102)

paragraph.name: b
