paragraph.content: in relation to a by-election for a constituency, designate one or more counting stations for counting the votes cast at all the polling stations used for polling for the by-election. (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004)

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer may require certain premises for use as polling stations or counting stations

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 28(1)(a), (b) or (c), the Chief Electoral Officer may, by written notice, require an owner or occupier of any target premises to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow an authorized person to carry out a site visit at the premises for enabling the Officer to determine whether the premises are suitable for use as a polling station or counting station in an election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Officer considers the premises suitable—take the steps specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The steps specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make available the premises for use as a polling station or counting station in the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to allow an authorized person to carry out preparatory work and store materials at the premises for a purpose relating to such use.

subsection.content: If any target premises are used as a polling station or counting station as a result of a person’s compliance with a requirement made under subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer must pay to the person a user fee for the period during which the premises are so used.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of the user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreed between the person and the Chief Electoral Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no agreement can be reached—determined by the court by reference to the loss suffered by the person for making available the premises.

subsection.content: A user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be paid out of the general revenue.
A person who fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1) is liable to pay a financial penalty of $50,000, which is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized in writing by the Chief Electoral Officer for the purposes of this section;

owner (業主), in relation to any target premises, means—(a)a person who appears from the records at the Land Registry to be the owner of—(i)the land on which the premises are situated; or(ii)if the land is divided into shares—an undivided share in the land that relates to the premises; and(b)a registered mortgagee in possession of such land or share;
target premises (目標處所) means a school or building described in section 28(2)(c) or (d) or any part of it.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to designate some polling stations as special polling stations

subsection.content: If the polling station or polling stations designated by the Chief Electoral Officer for a constituency would be difficult of access for persons with a disability, the Chief Electoral Officer must designate one or more polling stations as special polling station or stations to be used for voting by them. (12 of 2014 s. 98)
Only a polling station which is, in the opinion of the Chief Electoral Officer, suitable for use by persons referred to in subsection (1) may be designated as a special polling station.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate the same place as a special polling station for use by persons referred to in subsection (1) and a polling station for use by other electors. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: In a notice published under section 28(1), the Chief Electoral Officer must indicate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the special polling stations (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the constituency or constituencies for which a particular special polling station is designated. (12 of 2014 s. 98)

section.name: s30
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to assign polling stations for constituencies and to allocate polling stations to electors and authorized representatives

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may assign—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one or more polling stations for conducting the poll for each geographical constituency or functional constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more polling stations for conducting the poll for the Election Committee constituency. (14 of 2021 s. 104)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer may, in relation to a general election, make arrangements for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: voting for one or more functional constituencies to take place at a GC polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: voting for one or more geographical constituencies and one or more functional constituencies to take place at an ECC polling station. (14 of 2021 s. 104)

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must allocate to each elector and authorized representative a polling station or polling stations to cast the vote or votes he or she is entitled to cast at an election.

subsection.leadIn: Under subsection (3), for the purposes of a general election, the Chief Electoral Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (aa) and (ab), must allocate to a GC elector a GC polling station that is, as far as practicable, close to his or her registered residential address to cast the vote for the geographical constituency; (L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 104)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: may allocate to a GC elector who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment on the polling day a dedicated polling station to cast the vote for the geographical constituency; (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: may allocate to a GC elector who is also entitled to vote for the Election Committee constituency an ECC polling station to cast the vote for the geographical constituency and the vote for the Election Committee constituency; and (14 of 2021 s. 104)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may allocate to a GC elector the allocated polling station of the GC elector for either or both of the following purposes—

subparagraph.content: if the GC elector is also entitled to vote for a functional constituency as an authorized representative—to cast the vote for that functional constituency as an authorized representative. (14 of 2021 s. 104)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, allocate to an elector or authorized representative an alternative polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the polling station or any of the polling stations, as the case may be, allocated under subsection (3), to cast the vote or votes he or she is entitled to cast at an election. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

In this section, in relation to a person, the allocated polling station of the person is to be construed as the polling station, or the alternative polling station in addition thereto or in substitution thereof, that person is allocated under subsection (4)(a), (aa) or (ab) or subsection (4A). (L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 104)

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is serving a sentence of imprisonment or detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by the Commissioner of Correctional Services to the person for identification purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the head of any law enforcement agency must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is detained by the law enforcement agency under any lawful authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to send poll cards to electors and authorized representatives

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), for every contested election, at least 10 days before polling day, the Chief Electoral Officer must send a poll card to each elector and authorized representative.

subsection.leadIn: A poll card need not be sent to an elector or authorized representative if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer is satisfied, having regard to information received from the Registrar of Births and Deaths, that the elector or authorized representative is dead; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Chief Electoral Officer is satisfied that the elector’s or authorized representative’s address as recorded in the final register—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: does not exist;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: refers to a building that has been demolished; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: refers to a building that is not built at the time poll cards are to be sent.

subsection.content: A poll card need not be sent under subsection (1) to a corporate elector.

subsection.name: 3a
subsection.content: A poll card sent to an elector or authorized representative who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment in a prison on the polling day must be addressed to the elector or authorized representative and sent, as far as practicable, to the prison. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

If the Chief Electoral Officer receives notice of the substitution or replacement of an authorized representative within the 10 days preceding polling day, that Officer need not send a poll card to the substitute or replacement authorized representative. The Chief Electoral Officer must inform that substitute or replacement authorized representative of the polling station allocated to him or her in a manner that Officer thinks fit.
If a person is entitled to cast more than one vote at an election, the Chief Electoral Officer may send separate poll cards for each vote or send one poll card for all the votes.
The Chief Electoral Officer must state in the poll card or each poll card the polling station or stations at which the elector or authorized representative must cast his or her vote or votes.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: Where an alternative polling station is allocated to an elector or authorized representative under section 30(4A), the Chief Electoral Officer must, as soon as practicable, notify, in a manner that Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector or authorized representative;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the elector or authorized representative; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative polling station. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.def: In this section, corporate elector (團體選民) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542). (E.R. 6 of 2019)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Person to vote at the correct polling station

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person may only vote at the polling station or polling stations allocated to him or her under section 30.
A person who is allocated a special polling station under section 33 may only vote at that special polling station.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer may allocate special polling stations

subsection.content: An elector or authorized representative who claims to be a person with a disability and that access to the polling station which is allocated to him or her under section 30 is difficult for him or her due to the disability, may apply to the Chief Electoral Officer to vote at the special polling station designated for the constituency for which he or she is entitled to vote. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) must be made at least 5 days before polling day. The application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made in writing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission; or (12 of 2014 s. 56)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made orally by telephone. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.content: On receiving an application under subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer must, if satisfied that the application is well founded, allocate to the elector or authorized representative an appropriate special polling station to cast the vote he or she is entitled to cast at the election to which the application relates. (L.N. 65 of 2000)
The Chief Electoral Officer must inform the applicant in a manner that that Officer considers appropriate, the result of the application, as soon as practicable.

subsection.leadIn: When the Chief Electoral Officer allocates a special polling station to an elector or authorized representative under this section, that Officer must, as soon as practicable, notify, in a manner that the Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer at the special polling station; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the elector or the authorized representative,

subsection.continued: of the name, identity document number and registered residential address of that elector or authorized representative.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must notify the persons referred to in subsection (6) of the constituency or constituencies for which the elector or authorized representative is entitled to vote. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 105)

The Chief Electoral Officer may, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, allocate to an elector or authorized representative an alternative special polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the special polling station allocated under subsection (3), to cast the vote he or she is entitled to cast at the subsector election. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: Where an alternative special polling station is allocated to an elector or authorized representative under subsection (8), the Chief Electoral Officer must, as soon as practicable, notify, in a manner that Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector or authorized representative;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the persons referred to in subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative special polling station. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

section.name: s34
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to appoint or remove Presiding Officer, etc. for each polling station

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must appoint a person to preside at each polling station.
The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint, as polling officers, persons that Officer considers suitable to assist the Presiding Officer in the conduct of a poll. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

The Chief Electoral Officer may, at any time, with reasonable cause revoke the appointment of any Presiding Officer or polling officer made under subsection (1) or (2). (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 66 of 2008)

Where the same place is designated as both a polling station and a counting station under section 28(1A), the Presiding Officer of the polling station is to be regarded as the Presiding Officer of the counting station. (L.N. 66 of 2008)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply candidates with copy of final register

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each candidate for a geographical constituency a copy of the part of the final register which relates to the constituency for which that candidate is nominated. (14 of 2021 s. 106)

The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each candidate for a functional constituency a copy of the part of the final register which relates to the constituency for which that candidate is nominated. (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 106)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each candidate for the Election Committee constituency a copy of the Election Committee final register. (14 of 2021 s. 106)

A copy under this section must be supplied to a candidate as soon as practicable after the relevant nomination form is submitted to the Returning Officer. There may be added to the copy any additional particulars or information the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be in a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.
The copy for the purposes of this section may be supplied to the election agent of a candidate instead of the candidate to whom it is required to be supplied.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply Returning Officer with copy of final register

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Returning Officer for a geographical constituency or functional constituency a copy of the part of the final register relating to the constituency for which the Returning Officer is appointed. (14 of 2021 s. 107)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Returning Officer for the Election Committee constituency a copy of the Election Committee final register. (14 of 2021 s. 107)
A copy under this section must be supplied after the relevant notice of nominations is published.

There may be added to the copy the identity document numbers of the electors and authorized representatives and such other additional particulars or information as the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be in a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to carry out other duties relating to polling stations

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must provide at each polling station sufficient compartments as that Officer considers necessary to enable electors and authorized representatives to vote, screened from observation.

The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each Presiding Officer, the number of ballot papers the Chief Electoral Officer considers necessary for the constituency or constituencies for which the polling station is to be used for polling. The Chief Electoral Officer must ensure that the name of any deceased or disqualified candidate regarding whom notice under section 22A(1) or 22B(1) is given or declarations under section 22A(3) or 22B(3) are made, and other information relating to that candidate, if printed on the ballot papers, are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 1 of 2019 s. 31; 8 of 2025 s. 7)
The Chief Electoral Officer must also supply to the Presiding Officer a copy of the appropriate part of the final register or registers.

There may be added to the copy the identity document numbers of the electors and authorized representatives and such other additional particulars or information as the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be in a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must provide at each polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: materials; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is also assigned for conducting the poll for a geographical constituency, or for conducting the poll for an election for a functional constituency in relation to which the Commission has made a direction under section 57(2), or for conducting the poll for a by-election for the Election Committee constituency in relation to which the Commission has made a direction under section 58A(2)—chops bearing the mark “✓”, with or without other design, (14 of 2021 s. 108; 8 of 2025 s. 7)

subsection.continued: that are necessary to enable electors and authorized representatives to mark ballot papers. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must do other acts and things as that Officer considers necessary for holding the poll effectively.

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Presiding Officer to display notice relating to deceased or disqualified candidates

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of, and other information relating to, a candidate (applicable candidate) on a ballot paper are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is used for polling at a polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of the polling station must ensure that a notice specified in subsection (3) is displayed in a prominent place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station—outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station—inside the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicable candidate is—

subparagraph.content: a deceased candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 22A(3) has been made; or
a disqualified candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 22B(3) has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of, and other information relating to, the applicable candidate on the ballot paper are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2).

section.name: s38
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply list of polling officers to assist Presiding Officer

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Presiding Officer a list of the names of the polling officers appointed for the polling station for which that Presiding Officer is appointed.

The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Returning Officer for a constituency a list of the polling officers appointed for the polling stations at which polling for that constituency is to take place. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must display the list referred to in subsection (1) in a prominent place— (L.N. 73 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the Officer is appointed is not a dedicated polling station) outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the Officer is appointed is a dedicated polling station) inside the polling station. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Presiding Officer to exhibit at polling station notice providing information for the guidance of electors

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of a polling station must ensure that a notice providing information for the guidance of electors and authorized representatives in voting procedure is— (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exhibited—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, outside the polling station; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, inside the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibited inside every voting compartment of the polling station.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Presiding Officer of a small polling station must ensure that, before the commencement of the poll, a notice providing information of the main counting station designated for counting the votes cast at the polling station is exhibited outside the polling station. (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station must ensure that, before the commencement of the poll, there is exhibited inside the polling station a notice providing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information of the ballot paper sorting station, if any, designated for sorting the ballot papers received from the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information of the counting station or stations designated for counting the votes cast at the polling station. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) must be in the specified form.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Returning Officer to determine no canvassing zones and no staying zones

subsection.content: The Returning Officer for a constituency must determine an area outside each polling station used for polling for that constituency as a no canvassing zone and an area within that area as a no staying zone. A no canvassing zone and a no staying zone are to be determined with reference to a map or plan. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

If a polling station is to be used for polling for more than one constituency, the determination of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone is to be made by the Returning Officer specified for the purpose by the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

If the polling station is to be used only for one constituency, the Returning Officer for that constituency must give notice to the candidates for that constituency. (L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 109)

If a polling station is to be used for more than one constituency, and the Returning Officer who makes the determination is the Returning Officer for a constituency, that Officer must give notice to the candidates for that constituency and the Returning Officers for the other constituencies. (L.N. 84 of 2004)
Notice under subsection (4) or (6) must be given at least 7 days before polling day. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 109)

A Returning Officer who is given notice under subsection (6) must give notice to the candidates for the constituency for which that Officer is appointed as soon as practicable after that Officer receives the notice. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

A Returning Officer who makes a determination of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone may vary either or both those areas in accordance with this section. Subject to subsection (13), notice of a variation must be given as soon as practicable after the variation in the same manner as notice of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone is given under subsection (4), (6) or (8). (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 109)

On polling day, the Returning Officer who has determined the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone (or subsequently varied it, if applicable) must display at or near the polling station a notice of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone. That Officer must also indicate the boundaries of those zones in a manner that Officer thinks fit.

If after display under subsection (10), either or both of those areas are varied, the Returning Officer must display at or near the polling station a notice of the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone or both those zones, if appropriate, as varied.

subsection.name: 11a
subsection.content: A Returning Officer may perform any act which that Officer is required or authorized to perform under subsections (9), (10) and (11) through a Presiding Officer. (L.N. 66 of 2008)
A determination of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone or the variation of such an area becomes effective only on the display of a notice under subsection (10) or (11), as may be applicable.

A notice of a variation under subsection (11) need not be given to the candidates if it is not reasonably practicable to do so before the close of the poll. Notice may be given to the election agent or polling agent of a candidate if present at the polling station.
A notice required to be given to a candidate under this section may be given to the election agent or polling agent of the candidate instead of to the candidate.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, notice (通知、公告) means a notice of the determination of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone with a map or plan or separate maps or plans showing those zones in relation to the relevant polling station. (E.R. 6 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: On polling day, a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (17), engage in canvassing for votes in a no canvassing zone; (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: conduct any activity for canvassing for votes so that the sound of the activity can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 66 of 2008)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (19), use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 73 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device, for canvassing for votes, so that the sound emitted by it can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 65 of 2000)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (18), without reasonable excuse, display or wear in the no canvassing zone any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a prescribed body the registered name or registered emblem of which has been printed on any ballot paper for the election; or (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in the no staying zone without the express permission of the Presiding Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, on polling day, canvass for votes from door to door, without obstructing any person, on the storeys above or below street level, in a building within the no canvassing zone, which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is allowed to enter for the purpose of canvassing for votes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has no polling station inside it. (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.content: A person may, for the purpose of canvassing for votes as described in subsection (17), display or wear any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress referred to in subsection (16)(ca). (L.N. 84 of 2004)

An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on polling day, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

section.name: s41
section.heading: Presiding Officer to keep order in no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must use that Officer’s best endeavours to ensure that a person does not, on polling day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engage in the canvassing for votes in the no canvassing zone (except as provided in section 40(17)); (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: conduct any activity for canvassing for votes so that the sound of the activity can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004; L.N. 66 of 2008)

paragraph.name: b
c
ca
paragraph.leadIn: (except as provided in section 40(18)) without reasonable excuse, display or wear in the no canvassing zone any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a prescribed body the registered name or registered emblem of which has been printed on any ballot paper for the election; or (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in the no staying zone (except where the person has been expressly permitted to do so by the Presiding Officer).

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on polling day, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: If, on polling day, in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconducts himself or herself, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Returning Officer, that Officer may; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Presiding Officer, that Officer may,

subsection.continued: order the person to leave the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as the case may be, immediately.

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (2), the person may be removed by— (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as may be appropriate, is determined in relation to a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who is removed under subsection (3) may not enter the relevant zone again on that day, unless the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate, permits him or her to do so. (L.N. 84 of 2004)
The powers conferred by this section are not to be exercised so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Candidates may appoint polling agents

subsection.content: Candidates may appoint persons to attend at polling stations on their behalf for any purpose connected with the conduct of a poll, in accordance with this section.
Polling agents may be appointed to attend only at the polling stations used for polling for the constituency for which the candidate is standing for election. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 110)
A candidate may appoint a maximum of 2 polling agents for each polling station. (14 of 2021 s. 110)
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as a polling agent. (L.N. 147 of 1998)
A candidate must give notice of appointment of a polling agent to the Chief Electoral Officer at least 7 days before polling day. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 65 of 2000; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.name: 8AA
subsection.content: A notice of appointment given under subsection (8) must be delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1), (3) and (8)— (14 of 2021 s. 110)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), only one polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison; (14 of 2021 s. 110)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison if the Commissioner of Correctional Services has consented under section 23(18)(d) to the presence of the election agent of that candidate in that polling station; (14 of 2021 s. 110)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the appointment of a polling agent for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is not effective unless— (12 of 2014 s. 41)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice of appointment is given in accordance with subsection (8); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to the appointment. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.name: 8B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (8A)(d), even though a notice of appointment is given during the week before polling day, the Commissioner of Correctional Services may still give consent under that subsection if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (12 of 2014 s. 41)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody or authorized representative in custody who is entitled to vote for the relevant constituency at the polling station concerned is admitted or transferred to the prison concerned during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice of appointment is given without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.name: 8C
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (8A)(d), the Commissioner must notify the candidate or the election agent of the candidate as soon as practicable. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 110)

subsection.leadIn: A notice appointing a polling agent for a polling station other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison must, if it is not given under subsection (8), be delivered on the polling day to the Presiding Officer of the polling station— (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by the election agent of the candidate in person. (L.N. 147 of 1998; 14 of 2021 s. 110)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (8A)(d), the appointment of a polling agent is not effective until notice is received by the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate. (L.N. 65 of 2000; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name, identity card number and residential address of the polling agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 110)

subsection.content: If the appointment of a polling agent is revoked, the candidate must give notice of the revocation to the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer of the polling station in accordance with subsection (14) or (14A). (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 73 of 2011; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 110)

subsection.leadIn: If the notice of revocation is given before polling day, it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 73 of 2011; 12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.name: 14a
subsection.leadIn: If the notice of revocation is given on the polling day— (L.N. 73 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is not a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Presiding Officer of the polling station—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: by the election agent of the candidate in person; or (12 of 2014 s. 41; 14 of 2021 s. 110)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (12 of 2014 s. 41)

subsection.content: The revocation of the appointment of a polling agent is not effective unless notice is received by the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to delineate polling stations on a map and display map

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must delineate each polling station on one or more maps or plans. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must display a map or plan referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), outside the polling station concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the map or plan is prepared for a dedicated polling station, inside the polling station. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must demarcate clearly by marks, barriers or other means as that Officer thinks fit, the polling station in accordance with the map or plan referred to in subsection (1).
The Chief Electoral Officer and the Presiding Officer must carry out their functions under this section before the poll commences.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Who may enter or be present at a polling station

subsection.content: Except where it is provided otherwise in this Regulation, a person must not enter a polling station other than to vote.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), in order to ensure that polling takes place smoothly and efficiently, the Presiding Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulate the number of electors, authorized representatives, candidates, election agents and polling agents to be admitted to the polling station at any one time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exclude any person from the polling station.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (2), the Presiding Officer may exclude from the polling station any person who is present in contravention of this section.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may not exclude from the polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a polling officer;

paragraph.name: aa
b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officers or Assistant Returning Officers for the constituencies for which the polling station is used; (L.N. 65 of 2000)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: members of the Commission;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: public officers on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: public officers authorized in writing by the Chief Electoral Officer; (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: persons authorized in writing by a member of the Commission; (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: police officers and members of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 111)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer to act as a liaison officer; or (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 111)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an individual who provides the assistance mentioned in section 111(2)(c) pursuant to an authorization under that section. (14 of 2021 s. 111)

subsection.content: A person authorized by the Commission to be present in a polling station may be present in accordance with the terms of the authorization.
Subject to subsections (7), (8), (9), (10), (11) and (12), on behalf of each candidate, one polling agent of that candidate may be present in the polling station at any one time. (14 of 2021 s. 111)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: Subsection (6) does not apply to a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 130 of 2009)
If a candidate is present in the polling station, the election agent or polling agent of that candidate may not be present in that polling station at the same time. (14 of 2021 s. 111)
If the election agent of a candidate is present in the polling station, a polling agent of that candidate may not be present in that polling station at the same time. (14 of 2021 s. 111)
A candidate, an election agent or polling agent may be present in the polling station subject to the availability of seats in the area designated to accommodate them.

A person referred to in subsection (9) who wishes to be admitted to the polling station must, on arriving at the polling station, report in person to the Presiding Officer and produce his or her identity document and a declaration of secrecy completed on the specified form by him or her.

If the area referred to in subsection (9) is occupied to its full seating capacity, the Presiding Officer may refuse entry to the polling station to any person referred to in that subsection. That Officer may make arrangements for admitting them to the polling station later.
Only an election agent or polling agent regarding whom notice of appointment has been given under this Regulation may be present at a polling station on behalf of a candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 111)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person arrives at a polling station for the purpose of voting accompanied by a child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Presiding Officer considers that the child—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: should not be left unattended while the person is in the polling station; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: will not disturb or cause inconvenience to any person in the polling station,

subsection.continued: that Officer may permit the child to enter the polling station. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must not exercise the powers conferred on that Officer under this section so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person. (L.N. 147 of 1998)

section.name: s45
section.heading: What constitutes an offence at a polling station

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), if on polling day, within a polling station, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: communicates with an elector or an authorized representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses a mobile telephone, paging machine or any other device for electronic communication,

subsection.continued: contrary to a direction of the Returning Officer, Assistant Returning Officer, Presiding Officer or any polling officer not to do so, that person commits an offence. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, on polling day, films or takes photographs or makes any audio or video recording within a polling station without—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the express permission of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any member of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the express permission, in writing, of the Returning Officer for the constituency or constituencies for which the polling station is used for polling, (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.continued: commits an offence. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.content: A person who, on polling day, engages in the canvassing for votes or displays an election advertisement within a polling station commits an offence. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

A person who, on polling day, fails to comply with a lawful order given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer or behaves in a disorderly manner in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone or within or at a polling station or contravenes section 40(16) or 41(4), commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, displays or wears, on polling day and within a polling station, any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes direct reference to a body any member of which is standing as a candidate in the election or to a prescribed body the registered name or registered emblem of which has been printed on any ballot paper for the election, (L.N. 84 of 2004)

subsection.continued: commits an offence. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer or an Assistant Returning Officer; (L.N. 84 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer; (L.N. 147 of 1998)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by a member of the Commission to so communicate;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a polling officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer to act as a liaison officer;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a police officer on duty at a polling station; (L.N. 130 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at a polling station; (L.N. 130 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department on duty at a dedicated polling station; or (L.N. 130 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency on duty at a dedicated polling station. (L.N. 130 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence— (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under subsection (1), (3), (4) or (5) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (L.N. 84 of 2004 and L.N. 140 of 2004)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Presiding Officer to keep order at the polling station

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must keep order at the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: If, on polling day, in the polling station or its vicinity, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconducts himself or herself, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Returning Officer, that Officer may; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Presiding Officer, that Officer may,

subsection.continued: order the person to leave the polling station or the vicinity of the polling station, as the case may be, immediately.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If an elector or authorized representative who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station fails to cast his or her vote without undue delay pursuant to section 54(4), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may order him or her to leave the polling station immediately. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (2) or (2A), the person may be removed— (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, by a police officer or by a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who is removed under subsection (3) may not enter the relevant polling station again on that day, unless the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate, permits him or her to do so.
The powers conferred by subsection (2) are not to be exercised so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

division.name: D2
division.heading: Ballot Boxes and Ballot Papers and Procedure for Voting

section.name: s47
section.heading: Design of ballot box
section.content: A ballot box to be used for an election is to be so constructed that ballot papers can be introduced into it while it is locked but cannot be withdrawn from it without unlocking it or breaking the seal or the sealing device.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Presiding Officer to seal ballot box before commencement of poll

subsection.content: Immediately before the commencement of the poll, the Presiding Officer must show each ballot box, empty, to the persons, if any, as are then present within the polling station. Then the Presiding Officer must lock the ballot box, seal it with a seal provided for that purpose or any other device specified by the Chief Electoral Officer, so that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal or the device.

The Presiding Officer must place the ballot box for the receipt of ballot papers in that Officer’s view or in the view of any other polling officers, and must keep it locked and sealed. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

section.name: s49
section.heading: Form of ballot papers and order of appearance of names of candidates on ballot papers

subsection.content: A ballot paper to be used to vote for a geographical constituency is to be in Form 1 in Schedule 3.

A ballot paper to be used to vote for a functional constituency is to be in Form 3(a), 3(b), 3(c) or 3(d) in Schedule 3, as appropriate. (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 112; 8 of 2025 s. 9)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3B), a ballot paper to be used to vote for the Election Committee constituency is to be in Form 5(a) in Schedule 3. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: If the Commission has made a direction under section 58A(2) in relation to a by-election for the Election Committee constituency, a ballot paper to be used to vote at that by-election is to be in Form 5(b) in Schedule 3. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

The Chief Electoral Officer may modify the layout of the form of any ballot paper prescribed in Schedule 3 (except Forms 5(a) and 5(b) in that Schedule) to incorporate particulars relating to candidates to be printed on a ballot paper in accordance with the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M). (L.N. 84 of 2004; L.N. 47 of 2007; L.N. 66 of 2008; 14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may decide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have a ballot paper printed in white or in colour or colour pattern;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the colour in which a ballot paper is to be printed or the colour pattern to be printed on a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have different types of ballot paper printed in different colours or with different colour patterns;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether or not to have a design on the back of a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the design to be printed on the back of a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to have different designs printed on the back of different types of ballot papers.

subsection.content: The order in which the names of candidates appear on a GC ballot paper is to be determined by the Returning Officer by drawing lots. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: A number is to be allocated to each candidate for a geographical constituency according to the result of the draw, and the number is to be printed on the ballot paper against the name of the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 112)
The order in which the names of candidates appear on an FC ballot paper is to be determined by the Returning Officer by the drawing of lots. (L.N. 147 of 1998; L.N. 73 of 2011; 14 of 2021 s. 112)

Each functional constituency is to be assigned one or more letters of the alphabet by the Chief Electoral Officer as the code of the functional constituency. (L.N. 73 of 2011 and 11 of 2012 s. 63; 14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.content: Each candidate for a functional constituency is to be allocated a number preceded by the code assigned under subsection (8), according to the result of the draw. The code and the number are to be printed on the ballot paper against the name of the candidate. (L.N. 73 of 2011 and 11 of 2012 s. 63; 14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 10A
subsection.content: The order in which the names of candidates appear on an ECC ballot paper is to be determined by the Returning Officer by drawing lots. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 10B
subsection.content: A number is to be allocated to each candidate for the Election Committee constituency according to the result of the draw, and the number is to be printed on the ballot paper against the name of the candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 112)
A candidate may be present at the drawing of lots under this section or be represented by a person authorized in writing by him or her.
The Returning Officer must give notice to each candidate of the arrangements for the drawing of lots under this section. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.leadIn: A ballot paper is to contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the candidate;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: insofar as may be applicable to the candidate, the particulars specified in the Schedule to the Particulars Relating to Candidates on Ballot Papers (Legislative Council and District Councils) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. M); and (L.N. 66 of 2008; L.N. 143 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number or a letter of the alphabet allocated to the candidate under this section. (14 of 2021 s. 112)

subsection.name: 13a
subsection.leadIn: In the case of the death or disqualification of a candidate who has been allocated a number or a letter of the alphabet under this section, the name of the candidate and the information under subsection (13) relating to that candidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are to be omitted from the ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if printed on the ballot paper, are to be crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2). (L.N. 65 of 2000; 1 of 2019 s. 33; 8 of 2025 s. 9)

subsection.name: 13b
subsection.content: The number or letter of the alphabet allocated to a candidate under this section is not to be altered even if the information relating to another candidate for the constituency concerned who has died or is disqualified is omitted from the ballot paper, crossed out or endorsed with a marking under subsection (13A). (L.N. 65 of 2000; L.N. 84 of 2004; 8 of 2025 s. 9)
A ballot paper is to have the date and description of the election printed on the front of it.
A number may be printed on the counterfoil of a ballot paper, but that number is not to be printed or shown in any manner on the ballot paper.
A notice required to be given to a candidate under subsection (12) may be given to the election agent instead of to the candidate. (L.N. 147 of 1998)

section.name: s49A

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may designate an area in the polling station for giving a ballot paper to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is not less than 70 years of age;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose document specified in section 50(1A)(a), (ab), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows the year of birth, without the month and day of birth, of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: whose document specified in section 50(1A)(a), (ab), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows, without the day of birth—

subparagraph.content: the year of birth of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls; and
the month of birth of the person which is the same as the month within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: who is pregnant; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: who, because of illness, injury, disability or dependence on mobility aids—

subparagraph.content: is not able to queue for a long time; or
has difficulty in queuing.

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer is satisfied that a person who arrives at, or is present in, the polling station to vote falls within the description in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), the Officer may direct the person to immediately proceed to the following location to apply for a ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the area designated under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a queue extending from that area—the end of the queue.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Ballot paper to be given to person only if Presiding Officer is satisfied of person’s identity

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must not give a ballot paper to a person unless that Officer is satisfied, by inspecting the document or documents set out in subsection (1A) or (1B), that he or she is the person registered in the final register, whom he or she claims to be. (L.N. 129 of 2017)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a polling station (other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison), the document or documents referred to in subsection (1) are any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
ab
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) (Commissioner of Registration) to the person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; (L.N. 148 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document issued by the Commissioner of Registration acknowledging that the person has applied—

subparagraph.content: to be registered under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: c
d
e
f
paragraph.leadIn: both— (L.N. 148 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: a document evidencing a report to a police officer of the loss or destruction of the document referred to in paragraph (a), (ab) or (b); and (L.N. 148 of 2018)
a valid passport or similar travel document (not being one referred to in another paragraph in this subsection) issued to the person showing the person’s name and photograph. (L.N. 148 of 2018)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison, the document referred to in subsection (1) is a document issued by the Commissioner of Correctional Services showing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s photograph; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by that Commissioner to the person for identification purposes. (L.N. 129 of 2017)

subsection.content: A person is not to be prevented from voting only due to an omission or inaccuracy of a particular required to be recorded in a final register, other than the omission of both the person’s name and the identity document number.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Questions to be asked from persons applying for a ballot paper

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer may, at the time a person applies for a ballot paper, but not afterwards, ask, in case of doubt, the appropriate questions set out in subsection (3). (L.N. 147 of 1998)

When asking the questions, the Presiding Officer must have regard to whether the ballot paper applied for is a GC ballot paper, an FC ballot paper or an ECC ballot paper and the person applying for the ballot paper is an elector or an authorized representative. That Officer must choose, frame, adjust or modify the questions accordingly. (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 114)

subsection.leadIn: The questions referred to in subsections (1) and (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the final register now in effect for this geographical constituency, as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?” or “你是否已登記在就本地方選區正有效的正式登記冊上，並且有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the final register now in effect for this functional constituency, as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?” or “你是否已登記在就本功能界別正有效的正式登記冊上，並且有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?”;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the Election Committee final register, as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?” or “你是否已登記在選舉委員會正式委員登記冊上，並且有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?”; (14 of 2021 s. 114)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: “Have you already voted for this or any other geographical constituency in this election?” or “在這次選舉中，你是否已經就本地方選區或任何其他地方選區投票？”;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: “Have you already voted for this functional constituency in this election?” or “在這次選舉中，你是否已經就本功能界別投票？”; (L.N. 84 of 2004; 14 of 2021 s. 114)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: “Have you already voted for the Election Committee constituency in this election?” or “在這次選舉中，你是否已經就選舉委員會界別投票?”. (14 of 2021 s. 114)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must ask the appropriate questions set out in subsection (3) if so required by a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent.
The Presiding Officer must not give a ballot paper to any person who fails to answer the questions asked of that person under this section to the satisfaction of that Officer.

section.name: s52
section.heading: A candidate or election agent or polling agent may challenge a person who has applied for a ballot paper or who has voted

subsection.content: If a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent declares to the Presiding Officer that he or she has reasonable cause to believe that a person has engaged in corrupt conduct by impersonation and undertakes in writing to substantiate the allegation in a court, the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (2A). A candidate or an election agent or a polling agent may so declare only at the time a person applies for the ballot paper or after a person has applied for a ballot paper and before he or she has left the polling station.

If the Presiding Officer has reason to believe that a person applying for a ballot paper or who has applied for a ballot paper and who has not left the polling station has engaged in corrupt conduct by impersonation, the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (2A).

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The step specified for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, requesting a police officer to arrest the person concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, requesting an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency to remove the person concerned from the polling station and report the case to the police. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person regarding whom a declaration is made under subsection (1) (whether or not that person is arrested or removed under that subsection) or a person who has been arrested or removed pursuant to a request made under subsection (2) is not to be prevented from voting only by reason of the declaration, arrest or removal. (L.N. 73 of 2011)

In this section, the reference to corrupt conduct by impersonation is to be construed as the corrupt conduct referred to in section 15 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554). (10 of 2000 s. 47)

section.name: s53
section.heading: Presiding Officer to issue one or more ballot papers depending on the entitlement to vote

subsection.content: At a polling station used only for polling for a geographical constituency, the Presiding Officer is to issue only one ballot paper to an elector who applies for a ballot paper.

At a polling station used only for polling for a functional constituency, the Presiding Officer is to issue only one ballot paper to an elector or authorized representative who applies for a ballot paper.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: At a polling station used only for polling for the Election Committee constituency, the Presiding Officer is to issue only one ballot paper to an elector who applies for a ballot paper. (14 of 2021 s. 115)

subsection.leadIn: At a GC polling station that is also used for polling for one or more functional constituencies—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the GC elector is also entitled to vote for a functional constituency as an elector and the polling station is used for polling for that constituency—the Presiding Officer must also issue the FC ballot paper for that constituency to the elector; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the GC elector is also entitled to vote for a functional constituency as an authorized representative and the polling station is used for polling for that constituency—the Presiding Officer must also issue the FC ballot paper for that constituency to the elector. (14 of 2021 s. 115)

subsection.name: 4AA
subsection.leadIn: At an ECC polling station—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the ECC elector is also entitled to vote for a geographical constituency and the polling station is used for polling for that constituency—the Presiding Officer must also issue a GC ballot paper for that constituency to the elector;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the ECC elector is also entitled to vote for a functional constituency as an elector and the polling station is used for polling for that constituency—the Presiding Officer must also issue the FC ballot paper for that constituency to the elector; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the ECC elector is also entitled to vote for a functional constituency as an authorized representative and the polling station is used for polling for that constituency—the Presiding Officer must also issue the FC ballot paper for that constituency to the elector. (14 of 2021 s. 115)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: If an elector or authorized representative is entitled to be issued with 2 or more ballot papers, all the ballot papers must be handed over to him or her at the same time. (12 of 2014 s. 65)

Before issuing a ballot paper or ballot papers under this section, the name of the elector or authorized representative, as may be applicable, as stated in the copy of the relevant final register supplied under section 37(3) must be called out. (L.N. 65 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: Immediately before issuing the ballot paper or ballot papers, the Presiding Officer must— (L.N. 65 of 2000; 14 of 2021 s. 115)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a printed copy of the relevant final register is used to record the issue—mark the copy by placing a line across the name and identity document number of the elector or authorized representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an FR electronic copy or extract (as defined by section 109) of the relevant final register is used to record the issue—make, by using an electronic device, a record in the entry relating to the elector or authorized representative in the FR electronic copy or extract,

subsection.continued: to denote that the ballot paper or ballot papers the elector or authorized representative is entitled to have issued to him or her at the relevant polling station has been or have been so issued. (14 of 2021 s. 115)

subsection.content: No record is to be made of the particular ballot paper or ballot papers issued to an elector or authorized representative.

section.name: s53A
section.heading: Elector who has not cast vote may not return to cast vote unless permitted

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), if an elector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with one or more ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has left the polling station without casting the vote or any or all of the votes,

subsection.continued: the elector must not cast the uncast vote or votes when the elector returns to the polling station before the close of the poll unless— (12 of 2014 s. 66)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: before leaving the polling station, the elector has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made a request to the Presiding Officer for permission to cast the uncast vote or votes before the close of the poll;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: informed the Presiding Officer of the reason for leaving the polling station without casting the vote or any or all of the votes; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer has granted the requested permission; and (L.N. 130 of 2009)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station situated in a prison, the elector returns to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him or her under subsection (2A) or section 27(2A). (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 66)

subsection.content: If an elector has complied with subsection (1)(c), the Presiding Officer must grant the permission unless that Officer is of the opinion that the request is a manifest abuse of the facilities provided by this section.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison grants the permission to an elector under subsection (1), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer grants the permission to an elector under subsection (2), that Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in custody the ballot paper or papers returned by the elector under subsection (1)(c)(iii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the elector’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast the uncast vote or votes, re-issue the ballot paper or papers to the elector in the presence of a police officer or, if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 130 of 2009; 12 of 2014 s. 66)

subsection.content: If the Presiding Officer does not grant the permission to an elector under subsection (2), that Officer must immediately re-issue to the elector the ballot paper or papers returned under subsection (1)(c)(iii). (12 of 2014 s. 66)

subsection.leadIn: An elector who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with one or more ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become incapacitated from voting or completing the voting by physical illness; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: has left the polling station after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: returning the ballot paper or any or all of the ballot papers, unmarked, to the Presiding Officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: leaving the ballot paper or any or all of the ballot papers, unmarked, behind in the polling station without putting it or them into the ballot box or boxes (if the Presiding Officer is aware that the elector has so left the ballot paper or papers behind before leaving the polling station),

subsection.continued: may return to the polling station before the close of the poll and cast the uncast vote or votes. (12 of 2014 s. 66)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: If an elector in custody leaves a dedicated polling station situated in a prison under subsection (5), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The right of an elector in custody who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to cast the vote under subsection (5) is subject to the elector’s returning to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him or her under subsection (5A) or section 27(2A). (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If any ballot paper is returned under subsection (5)(c)(i) or left behind in the polling station under subsection (5)(c)(ii) by an elector, the Presiding Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in custody the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the elector’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast the vote, re-issue the ballot paper to the elector in the presence of a police officer or, if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 130 of 2009)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, re-issuing a ballot paper under subsection (3), (4) or (6) is to be regarded as issuing a ballot paper under section 53(1), (2), (3A) or (4). (14 of 2021 s. 116)
In this section, references to “elector” are to be construed as including an authorized representative. (L.N. 140 of 2004)

section.name: s54
section.heading: Procedure for voting
